message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel scheme for human action recognition in videos using a 3D CNN based classifier. The proposed technique involves aggregating consecutive frames of a video into a single frame using a Gaussian-weighted summation, which preserves information better than conventional approaches. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a 3D CNN architecture to extract spatio-temporal features and follows Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) to recognize human actions, indicating that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also experiments with human action datasets, suggesting that it may belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the use of a neural network classifier suggests that the paper may also belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
